{"step_by_step_thinking": "Systemic Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis (SJRA) is a form of juvenile idiopathic arthritis that affects multiple joints and can also involve other organs. To determine the correct answer, we need to understand the features of SJRA. Uveitis, which is inflammation of the uvea in the eye, can occur in SJRA. Rash is also a common feature of SJRA, often presenting as a salmon-pink rash. Fever is a hallmark symptom of SJRA and is usually high-grade and persistent. Hepatosplenomegaly, which is enlargement of the liver and spleen, is also seen in SJRA. Therefore, the correct answer is none of the above options. ", "answer_choice": "D"}
